page.title: 09Ditchling Retirement Homes
page.content: To the north of the village are ll cottage homes built 98 years ago for retired Lightermen and Watermen of the River Thames, all of whom have the freedom of the River Thames.A member of the Leaney family has been a care_ taker there since the cottages were built by the Vokins family of Brighton.In East End Lane are three Lucy Brangwyn Cottages,a charitable trust set up by the artist Frank Brangwyn in memory of his wife. Recently completed is Dumbrell's Court (on the site of the old private school known as Dumbrells) described as "luxuriously appointed retirement homes in an idyllic downland village". These consist of a total of 34 dwell_ ings consisting of flats,bungalows,and cottages.
